thread.section_title: News24, South Africa's premier news source, provides breaking news on national, world, Africa, sport, entertainment, technology & more.
thread.title: Wits Fees Protest Trauma

author: news24.com
title: Wits Fees Protest Trauma
text: I am a white university student who was supporting the Wits fees protest for the entire day. I broke my leg a few months ago I am currently still on crutches! After hours of support, I went to finish an assignment and tried to leave the university a few hours later. I was met as a white women of white privilege, not as a comrade. Irrespective of the fact that I'd been supporting for hours before, I was pushed around, surrounded and screamed at. All sorts of profanities about white privilege were thrown around and I was called a racist. If the fees increase, I will not be able to afford to go to university anymore. I was in tears! All I wanted to do was to go home! It just proves that it turned into a race issue, not a financial one. I am appalled! This incident has been so traumatic for me!
